courseStructure.title: Introduction to Web Development
courseStructure.description: This beginner-level course is designed to provide a comprehensive introduction to web development, covering the fundamental concepts and technologies needed to build basic websites. The course is structured for a learning pace of 2 hours per week, making it accessible for those with busy schedules.

modules.title: The Basics of Web Development
objectives: Understand the basic components of a website
Learn the role of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript in web development
Familiarize with the structure and syntax of HTML

modules.title: HTML: Structure and Content
objectives: Understand the basic structure of an HTML document
Learn how to create headings, paragraphs, and lists
Explore common HTML elements for structuring content

modules.title: CSS: Styling Web Pages
objectives: Understand the purpose and syntax of CSS
Learn how to apply styles to HTML elements
Explore basic CSS properties for formatting text, colors, and layout

modules.title: CSS: Layouts and Responsive Design
objectives: Understand the concept of responsive web design
Learn how to create basic page layouts using CSS
Explore techniques for making websites mobile-friendly

modules.title: JavaScript: Adding Interactivity
objectives: Understand the basic syntax and structure of JavaScript
Learn how to manipulate HTML elements using JavaScript
Explore simple JavaScript functions and event handling

modules.title: Putting it All Together: Building a Simple Website
objectives: Apply the concepts learned throughout the course to build a basic website
Integrate HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to create an interactive web page
Understand the process of publishing a website online
